FAO state of food insecurity in the world 2014_out.html

The TF-IDF algorithm has been used for the results. While using a minimum score of 0.3 and minimum average word weight of 0.01. If the score per category doesn't contain any scores it has been left out in the overview. Keep in mind that the term weight values are multiplied based on their PoS value. Only the PoS tags verb, noun, adjunctive and SPEC have a PoS value of 1. The rest have a value of 0.

JJ unger reduction requires an integrated approach which would include public and private investments to raise agricultural productivity better access to inputs land services technologies and markets measures to promote rural development social protection for the most vulnerable including strengthening their resilience to conflicts and natural disasters and specific nutrition programmes especially to address micronutrient deficiencies in mothers and children under five

FAO Acknowledgements Undernourishment around the world in Progress in hunger reduction continues The MDG hunger target is within reach… …but the World Food Summit target cannot be met Key findings Beyond undernourishment insights from the suite of food security indicators Analysing the dimensions of food security Empirical findings from the suite of indicators Key findings Strengthening the enabling environment to improve food security and nutrition lessons learned from the analysis of individual countries Plurinational State of Bolivia Brazil Haiti Indonesia Madagascar Malawi Yemen Key findings Technical annex Annex Prevalence of undernourishment and progress towards the World Food Summit WFS and the Millennium Development Goal MDG targets in developing regions Annex The prevalence of undernourishment indicator Annex Glossary of selected terms used in the report Notes O T S Foreword O O D hen the th United Nations General Assembly begins its General Debate on September days will remain to the end of the target date for achieving the Millennium Development Goals MDG

Several government institutions are involved in the implementation and coordination of food security policies creating broad governance structure the Ministry of Agriculture Irrigation and Water Development is responsible for formulating and implementing agricultural policies the Department of Nutrition HIV and AIDS coordinates nutrition measures and the Ministry of Finance Economic Planning and Development is charged with coordinating and planning resilience and social protection programmes and disaster and risk management

Estimates of the number of undernourished NoU calculated by multiplying the PoU by the size of the reference population are used to monitor progress towards the World Food Summit goal of reducing by half the number of people suffering from undernourishment

The Holt Winters model uses process known as exponential smoothing which attributes higher weights to more recent data and progressively less weight to older observations

Label: 0, with a score of: 1

Weights decrease in each period by constant amount which lies on an exponential curve

Label: 0, with a score of: 1

For countries showing peculiar patterns other simpler forecasting models were used such as linear or exponential trends

Label: 0, with a score of: 1

The method applied in this edition of The State of Food Insecurity in the World to assess the robustness of statistics for sample is known as the leave out one cross validation approach

With this approach for sample of size subsamples of size n are created in which each observation is systematically left out of one subsample

Label: 8, with a score of: 0.685774610417832
WordScorePoS
approach0NN
size0.049270765107907NN
create0.0695218668857431VB

For each subsample the sensitivity of the statistic of interest in this case the SK parameter to the excluded observation can be analysed and observations that have large impact are removed

Label: 12, with a score of: 0.881537867040571
WordScorePoS
impact0.0866018859977851NN
remove0.0542519672965169VB

The method allows robust calculation of the SK parameter that is insensitive to any single observation found in the dataset

Label: 0, with a score of: 1

In this edition of The State of Food Insecurity in the World an extension of the method described above is used based on linear regression linking the log of per capita income to per capita calorie consumption along with indicator variables for the month in which the survey was conducted to control for seasonality

new computation of variability due to requirement To obtain the total variability in food consumption used to calculate the PoU the variability that is due to income is added to the variability due to all other factors that are not correlated with income Much of the variability orthogonal to income is due to differences in energy requirement which are in turn largely THE STATE OF FOOD INSECURITY IN THE WORLD Annex determined by population structure as well as by physical activity levels life styles access to safe drinking water and progress in health care and disease reduction

■■ Estimating the MDER threshold ■■ Limitations of the methodology and frequent critiques To calculate the MDER threshold FAO employs normative energy requirement standards from joint FAO WHO United Nations University expert consultation in

These standards are obtained by calculating the needs for basic metabolism that is the energy expended by the human body in state of rest and multiplying them by factor that takes into account physical activity referred to as the physical activity level PAL index

In the debate on measuring undernourishment the FAO methodology has frequently attracted two criticisms The indicator underestimates undernourishment as it assumes level of physical activity associated with sedentary lifestyle while poor people are often engaged in physically demanding activities

Body mass index BMI
